Dialog: Most modern computers and mobile devices do not like it when a game is stopped while a dialog window is shown. They tend to interpret this as game runner having stopped, and may consider it an error and close the app prematurely. To prevent this GameMaker Studio 2 has asynchronous dialog functions that permit you to request certain forms of user feedback or input, but without blocking the game runner at any time, meaning that - when called - the game will run as normal in the background while the user responds to the shown dialog window. Once the user has responded, a Dialog Asynchronous Event will be called so that you can deal with the results.

NOTE: This means that if it is possible for the player to lose the game, get killed, etc... while this dialog is being shown, then you should take steps to create a pause system, otherwise it'll be an unpleasant user experience.
